001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.util.List;
004import java.util.Optional;
005
006import org.immutables.value.Value;
007
008import io.github.ai4ci.Data;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Abstraction.Entity;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Abstraction.HistoricalStateProvider;
011import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.StateMachine;
012import io.github.ai4ci.util.Ephemeral;
013
014/**
015 * The main Person class is a mutable holder that contains immutable data
016 * pertaining to baseline, current state, recent history etc.
017 * <p>
018 * Implementations are generated by Immutables and are used throughout the
019 * simulation to represent individuals, their baseline metadata, and transient
020 * state during an update cycle.
021 */
022@Value.Modifiable
023@Data.Mutable
024public abstract class Person
025                implements Entity, HistoricalStateProvider<PersonHistory> {
026
027        /**
028         * Creates a new person and adds them into the outbreak network. The created
029         * person is a minimal "stub" instance: it will be assigned an id and
030         * outbreak reference; other fields will be initialised with sensible empty
031         * values so that the instance can be safely used during network
032         * construction.
033         *
034         * @param outbreak the outbreak instance this person will belong to
035         * @return a modifiable person stub attached to the provided outbreak
036         */
037        public static ModifiablePerson createPersonStub(Outbreak outbreak) {
038                var tmp = new ModifiablePerson();
039                tmp.setOutbreak(outbreak);
040                var id = outbreak.getPeople().put(tmp);
041                tmp.setId(id);
042                tmp.setNextHistory(Ephemeral.empty());
043                tmp.setNextState(Ephemeral.empty());
044                tmp.setStateMachine(StateMachine.stub());
045                tmp.setDemographic(PersonDemographic.stub(tmp));
046                return tmp;
047        }
048
049        /**
050         * {@inheritDoc}
051         */
052        @Override
053        public final boolean equals(Object another) {
054                return super.equals(another);
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * Immutable baseline information for this person (e.g. comorbidities,
059         * baseline behaviours). This is stable for the duration of a simulation run.
060         *
061         * @return the {@link PersonBaseline} for this person
062         */
063        public abstract PersonBaseline getBaseline();
064
065        /**
066         * Gets the first history item unless there is no history. If called during
067         * update cycle this will get the history at the same time as the current
068         * state. If called after it will be the previous day.
069         *
070         * @return an {@link Optional} containing the most recent
071         *         {@link PersonHistory} or {@link Optional#empty()} if no history
072         *         exists
073         */
074        public Optional<PersonHistory> getCurrentHistory() {
075                if (this.getHistory().size() == 0) { return Optional.empty(); }
076                return Optional.of(this.getHistory().get(0));
077        }
078
079        /**
080         * The current immutable state of the person for the current simulation
081         * timestep. This represents the snapshot of their epidemiological and
082         * behavioural state used for computing transitions.
083         *
084         * @return the current {@link PersonState}
085         */
086        public abstract PersonState getCurrentState();
087
088        /**
089         * Demographic information for the person such as age group and other
090         * population-level stratifiers used in the simulation.
091         *
092         * @return the {@link PersonDemographic} instance
093         */
094        public abstract PersonDemographic getDemographic();
095
096        /**
097         * Reverse time ordered list of historical states (recent first).
098         *
099         * @return list of {@link PersonHistory} entries in reverse chronological
100         *         order
101         */
102        @Override
103        public abstract List<PersonHistory> getHistory();
104
105        /**
106         * The unique numeric identifier for this person within the outbreak network.
107         *
108         * @return person's id (non-null)
109         */
110        public abstract Integer getId();
111
112        /**
113         * Only populated during the update cycle largely as a mapping from the t-1
114         * state. Historical events are added most notably test sampling.
115         *
116         * @return ephemeral builder for next person history
117         */
118        public abstract Ephemeral<ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder> getNextHistory();
119
120        /**
121         * Only populated during the update cycle, and copied from the t-1 state.
122         * This is where changes to the future t state are made.
123         *
124         * @return ephemeral builder for next person state
125         */
126        public abstract Ephemeral<ImmutablePersonState.Builder> getNextState();
127
128        /**
129         * The outbreak this person belongs to. Never null for a created person.
130         *
131         * @return the associated {@link Outbreak}
132         */
133        public abstract Outbreak getOutbreak();
134
135        /**
136         * The person's behavioural state machine.
137         *
138         * @return the person's {@link StateMachine} for behaviour transitions
139         */
140        public abstract StateMachine getStateMachine();
141
142        /**
143         * Returns a persistent unique resource name for this person within the
144         * outbreak, used primarily for logging and diagnostics.
145         *
146         * @return URN string in the form {@code <outbreak-urn>:person:<id>}
147         */
148        @Override
149        public String getUrn() {
150                return this.getOutbreak().getUrn() + ":person:" + this.getId();
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * {@inheritDoc}
155         *
156         * Implementations delegate equality and hashing to object identity for
157         * mutable persons: these methods are final to prevent accidental
158         * redefinition in generated classes.
159         */
160        @Override
161        public final int hashCode() {
162                return super.hashCode();
163        }
164
165        /**
166         * Returns the URN for this person. This provides a human-friendly
167         * representation useful for logging.
168         */
169        @Override
170        public String toString() {
171                return this.getUrn();
172        }
173}
